name: Scullery Made Tea - Barossa Breakfast 100g
description:
Barossa Breakfast is made from the very best Darjeeling whole leaf tea blended with a fine flavoured whole leaf Ceylon. Darjeeling is often referred to as the ‘champagne’ of teas, and we all know that’s a breakfast drink, but it’s the natural muscatel flavour of this particular Darjeeling that gives a firm nod to the Barossa. 

A local take on the traditional ‘English Breakfast’, Barossa Breakfast can be served black or with added milk.

name: Scullery Made Tea - The Orange Earl 100g
description:
The Orange Earl is made from a superb whole leaf black tea that has been infused    with bergamot oil - the classic Earl Grey. To this, the zest of home grown, pesticide free Barossa oranges has been added to really boost the citrus flavour. 

With or without milk, this is the tea for all Earl Grey lovers who find their palates are always asking for more citrus please. The perfect choice for afternoon tea or with anything of a dark chocolate persuasion.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Chocolate Marmalade 100g
description:
Chocolate tea is a truly marvellous thing. Oh. Yes. Add a nod to the Valley with locally grown orange zest and we're talking about a seriously unctuous blend. 

Whole black tea is hand blended with organic Mexican cacao and supersized chunks of carob for a flavour that is pure chocolate without being too sweet. Enjoy with or without milk, and if your sweet tooth is still crying out for more, a spoonful of honey.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Beekeeper's Breakfast 100g
description:
The brilliance in being part of the Barossa Farmer’s Market is not just to share our own wares, but also to have direct access to fellow small producers and their handcrafted goodies. One such producer is ‘Buzz’. He knows everything there is to know about honey and we love nothing more than learning all we can from him about his amazing craft. Because, put simply, we think bees are amazing. 

So here’s cheers to Buzz and all he does; a brew of black tea leaves soaked in raw honey, with bee pollen, calendula, apple and ginger. A tea fit for a beekeeper’s breakfast.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Barossa Bushgardens 100g
description:
Made with whole black tea, lemon scented grass, quandongs and muntries, this blend has been put together to celebrate the amazing work The Barossa Bushgardens are doing to preserve the local flora that the Valley has, at one time nurtured, and more recently, nearly lost. 

The fresh citrus of lemon scented grass with the lovely plum-tart flavours of muntries and quandong in this blend takes the billy into high tea territory, but never too posh for a bonfire we can assure you.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Sunday Roast 100g
description:
Made with whole black tea, roasted barley and wattleseed, ginger, cinnamon and cloves, this is a warmly spiced blend just begging for a picnic blanket or an open fire. It's our nod to all the chai lovers while still keeping inspiration from the flavours of the Barossa front of mind.

In fact the blend began after tasting the beautifully roasted wattleseed at our local Farmer's Market, from a farm just up the road from us. It's the kind of chai farmers would drink if farmers ever did drink chai.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Camellia Society 100g
description:
Camellia Society is the club for all afternoon tea lovers. Sipping and chatting their way through the flavours of where the rose garden meets the orchard. This is our prettiest tea yet! 

With whole black tea leaves, rose buds and petals, almond and apricot kernals and a hint of cinnamon, this is the perfect choice to draw a gathering of your favourite ladies together and eat cucumber sandwiches until the scones are ready. Fancy pants are optional.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Green Apples 100g
description:
Green Apples is just as the name would suggest, a bright combination of Bancha green tea and dried apple pieces. 

For any green tea lover this blend will offer the tart sweetness of apple, not usually associated with Bancha, and for those yet to be convinced of how delicious green tea can be, this is a great starting point. 

Bancha is a ‘rounder’ green tea, that doesn’t have any of the bitterness that can sometimes sneak through with other green tea, especially if left to overbrew.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Alabaster 50g
description:
Made with the leaves that deliver the world’s highest antioxidant levels - white tea - in fact, White Peony to be exact, this blend is as indulgent as it is good for you. Which makes sense when you find out it was created as an exclusive signature blend for the beautiful store that bears its name. What else but white tea for Alabaster right? 

To this amazing whole leaf we’ve added mandarin, ginger and lavender to really show off the spicy sweetness that good white tea is renowned for. Sip in the pureness of white. Ommm my.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Nosh 100g
description:
Another signature blend for its namesake cafe - Nosh is a local icon. And with a name like that you can imagine that a tea to match has to come up with the flavour goods. The kind of tea you could drink an entire pot of all to yourself. 

With organic rooibus, vanilla beans and a nod to the carob tree lined street that Nosh sits on, with chunky carob pieces, this tea is completely caffeine free, but can still have milk added. It's great iced too.  A little something to suit every taste. 

If you've ever visited the Tanunda cafe with its vintage chairs and mixed matched plates you'll know what we mean. It's a local thing. That's Nosh.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Clubhouse Lane 100g
description:
Made with a beautiful rooibos-like tea called honeybush, along with orange zest,  cinnamon, cloves and calendula petals, this blend straddles the magical worlds of being completely caffeine free but still happy to have milk added.  

Dreamt up as a signature blend for its lovely namesake cafe on Clubhouse Lane, this is the tea for rooibos devotees who are up for a little nod to the sweetness of caramelised honey to hold hands with the health benefits of warming spices. We think it’s kind of like a honey mead meets creme caramel - in a completely vegan way. You know.

name: Scullery Made Tea - High Brew 100g
description:
What does a tea blender do when they stumble across an ancient Ayurvedic tea recipe that helps to uplift the spirits and cheerlead for your digestive system? Takes the suggestion and adds a few more bits and bobs to give it the Scullery treatment, that’s what! Actually quite a few more bits and bobs. 

This super healthy, extremely elegant herbal tea is a balanced blend of peppermint, apple, cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, basil, eucalyptus, lemongrass, liquorice and fennel, with lemon, parsley, cloves and oregano. We love it iced with a dash of soda too.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Rainwater Mint 50g
description:
This herbal blend was inspired by all the farmhouse rainwater tanks that are surrounded with mint. Because we all know that's the best place for it. Such beautifully simple logic has encouraged a beautifully simple tea - all mint and nothing but mint! 

Whole peppermint leaves are combined with our own garden mint that has literally gone 'wild'. Still the uncontested, most soothing way to finish a meal in our books but that should never stop you brewing up a pot of minty herbal goodness at any time of the day.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Wine & Roses 100g
description:
Wine & Roses is an extremely flavoursome and elegant herbal tea.  Made with handpicked, pesticide free rose petals, wild rosehips from Koonunga Hill, Barossa muscatels, cornflowers and local wax free lemon zest, this blend really shows off the edible beauty of the Barossa. 

Also gorgeous as an iced drink in Summer, with a natural sweetness that needs no added sugar. Or try it as a base for poaching fruit in - the resulting rubescent syrup is reason enough, let alone the flavour.

name: Scullery Made Tea - Chamomile Citron 50g
description:
Chamomile Citron is an extremely grown up herbal tea, with layers of citrus aromas that are the first thing you ‘taste’ when you brew a pot of this pretty blend. Perfect for anyone who loves lemon, this has locally grown lemon verbena and lemon balm, with lemongrass and whole chamomile flowers. 

A wonderful way to finish a meal or ease any over indulgence of the food and wine kind - but we don’t know anything about that in the Barossa!

name: Scullery Made Tea - Fowler's Jar Collection
description:
It only took 2 years and much pleading to make this happen, and my fear is it may not last for very long! 

These fowler’s tea jars are the thing everyone asks about and so finally, finally I have managed to wangle enough Nannas to share their extra preserving jars, so we can offer our very first limited edition tea collection with authentic country wear. Rustic but never rusty. 

The 3 favourites all in a row. Barossa Breakfast, The Orange Earl and Rainwater Mint. Just begging for a butler’s pantry!

name: Scullery Made Bespoke Tea Cups
description:
It's quite a special thing to be friends with a potter who loves tea as much as we do. Handmade tea cups are inevitable! 

These beautiful cups are all turned on a potter's wheel in the Barossa, especially for Scullery Made, and we couldn't love them more. The kind of cup you can wrap both hands around is what we all need at one point or another in the day. 

Each cup has its own inspirational message - your tea will taste all the better for it. That's the conclusion we've arrived at after some serious sipping experience and we're only too happy to share.

name: Scullery Made Organic Hemp Nut Milk Bag
description:
We love homemade almond milk here in the Scullery, but we really don't love how all the nut milk bags we've bought in the past seem to split under pressure. 

What to do? Ask Mum to make it better. Literally. And she has. With organic hemp fabric and the kind of seam work only a mother could pull off, these nut milk bags are the best we've ever had. Thanks Mum.

name: Scullery Made Organic Gluten Free Whole Flour Mix
description:
This organic wholefood flour mix cracks the code for easily adding high vitamin gluten free flours into your baking. 

Simply swap this handblended mix, gram for gram, for refined white flour in any of your favourite cake or cookie recipes, and shazam - you have 10 whole grain flours in every mouthful.

name: Scullery Made Tea Cup Light
description:
What better way to bring some light to any subject, than via a pretty tea cup and saucer? We've been on a vintage driven mission to find as many beautiful old tea cups and saucers to up cycle into pendant lights so tea lovers can take their obsession well beyond the table. 

All the tea cup lights are mix matched cups and saucers with varying colours and prints, but we can assure you all are very, very pretty, so our idea of 'feeling' the right choice for you should work a treat! Lights come with 1 metre of old school twisted cloth wrapped cord and are wired up to be able to be plugged in straight away. 

If however, you were wanting to hang your tea cup as a pendant light, then you just need to ask your friendly electrician to remove the plug and hardwire the light directly into a ceiling rose instead.

name: Alabaster 50g
description:
